Summary: Bright light moving briskly from west to east. No sound or flashing wing lights.
divs: Sighting DetailsI was on my back deck, which essentially faces west. It was around 8:30 and I was enjoying the evening air and watching the stars come out. I was also enjoying a good cigar and a scotch. I'm in the Sierra foothills at about 3500'. From the west came a bright light moving briskly. Not super fast, but probably faster than a typical piston engine aircraft. It was twilight and a few stars were starting to become visible. This object was a bright light and I could see no other "parts". It was moving eastward and made no sound. There were no blinking lights and I could see nothing that would indicate an airplane of any sort. It disappeared behind the trees after about 8 seconds so I moved to the front of the house (east). It reappeared from behind the trees and continued on eastward. The light were definitely not a landing light. It remained the same brightness as it approached and as it left. There are no airports in this area. I would guess the altitude to be somewhere between 2000 and 4000 feet. The neighborhood was pretty quiet and I heard not sound whatsoever. That is why I decided to file this report. The included picture was taken earlier this month during the day. I tried to make it look like twilight, while showing the size of the light. The bottom of the picture is west-southwest. The top left is east-northeast. I did not see a "disk" shape. Just a very bright white light.
trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Pioneer

This sighting has never been favorited.
